senses.sense_definition: To give a description or information about something that has happened or is happening, often officially or publicly.

examples.text: The journalist will <w>report</w> on the election results live from the capital.
Witnesses <w>reported</w> seeing a strange light in the sky last night.

senses.sense_definition: To tell a person in authority about a crime, accident, illness, or bad behavior.

examples.text: If you see any suspicious activity, please <w>report</w> it to the police immediately.
She threatened to <w>report</w> her colleague to the manager for bullying.

senses.sense_definition: To work under the authority of a specific manager and be responsible to them.

examples.text: In my new role, I will <w>report</w> directly to the marketing director.
The entire engineering team <w>reports</w> to the Chief Technology Officer.

senses.sense_definition: To arrive at a specific place or time, usually for work, military service, or an official meeting.

examples.text: All soldiers must <w>report</w> for duty by six o'clock in the morning.
Please <w>report</w> to the front desk as soon as you enter the building.

senses.sense_definition: A spoken or written account that gives information about a particular subject, situation, or event.

examples.text: The manager asked for a detailed <w>report</w> on the project's progress.
According to the weather <w>report</w>, it is going to rain all weekend.

senses.sense_definition: An employee who is managed by a specific person in a company hierarchy.

examples.text: The manager holds weekly meetings with every direct <w>report</w> on her team.
He treats his direct <w>report</w> with respect and offers constant guidance.

senses.sense_definition: A sudden, sharp, and loud noise, such as that made by a gunshot or an explosion.

examples.text: We heard the loud <w>report</w> of a rifle coming from the nearby woods.
The sudden <w>report</w> of the fireworks startled the sleeping dog.

senses.sense_definition: The way people regard or talk about someone; reputation.

examples.text: He was a man of good <w>report</w> and was trusted by all the villagers.
The scandal caused an evil <w>report</w> of him to spread throughout the town.
